title: Kent Senior Cup
text:
The Kent Senior Cup is an <a href="England">English</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> competition played between senior clubs in the county of <a href="Kent">Kent</a>. It is administered by the <a href="Kent%20County%20Football%20Association">Kent County Football Association</a>.
History.
The Kent Badge preceded the Kent Senior Cup, and was won in its three-year history by <a href="Chatham%20Town%20F.C.">Chatham</a>. This competition was replaced by the Kent Senior Cup in 1889. Between 1894 and 1897 the cup was awarded to the Kent League champions.
Past winners of the Kent Senior Cup include <a href="Arsenal%20F.C.">Royal Arsenal</a> (now Arsenal) in <a href="1889-90%20in%20English%20football">1889–90</a>, and <a href="Gillingham%20F.C.">Gillingham</a> in <a href="1945-46%20in%20English%20football">1945–46</a> and <a href="1947-48%20in%20English%20football">1947–48</a>; the two sides are now members of the <a href="Premier%20League">Premier League</a> and <a href="Football%20League">Football League</a> respectively. The 2013–14 Kent Senior Cup marked the 125th anniversary year of the competition, with the first match having been played in 1889. The final was played at <a href="Priestfield%20Stadium">Priestfield Stadium</a>, home of Gillingham, on 5 May 2014 and was won by <a href="Ebbsfleet%20United">Ebbsfleet United</a>, beating <a href="Dover%20Athletic%20F.C.">Dover Athletic</a> 4-0. Just days later, Dover Athletic would beat Ebbsfleet United 1-0 in the <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20Football%20Conference%23Conference%20South">Conference South</a> playoff final to win promotion to the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Football%20Conference">Conference Premier</a>.
<a href="Charlton%20Athletic%20F.C.">Charlton Athletic</a> beat <a href="Gillingham%20F.C.">Gillingham</a> 1-0 at <a href="Priestfield%20Stadium">Priestfield Stadium</a> on 30 April 2015 in the 2014–15 final.
<a href="Dartford%20F.C.">Dartford</a> beat <a href="Charlton%20Athletic%20F.C.">Charlton Athletic</a> 3-1 at <a href="Princes%20Park%20%28Dartford%29">Princes Park</a> on 26 April 2016 in the 2015–16 final.
<a href="Dover%20Athletic%20F.C.">Dover Athletic</a> beat <a href="Welling%20United%20F.C.">Welling United</a> 2-0 at <a href="Gallagher%20Stadium">Gallagher Stadium</a> on 1 May 2017 in the 2016–17 final.
<a href="Maidstone%20United%20F.C.">Maidstone United</a> beat <a href="Folkestone%20Invicta%20F.C.">Folkestone Invicta</a> 4-3 on penalties after a 0-0 draw at <a href="Gallagher%20Stadium">Gallagher Stadium</a> on 24 April 2018 in the 2017–18 final.
<a href="Maidstone%20United%20F.C.">Maidstone United</a> beat <a href="Bromley%20F.C.">Bromley</a> 3-2 on penalties after a 1-1 draw at <a href="Hayes%20Lane">Hayes Lane</a> on 16 April 2019 in the 2018–19 final to retain the Cup.
<a href="Dartford%20F.C.">Dartford</a> beat <a href="Whitstable%20Town%20F.C.">Whitstable Town</a> 6-1 at <a href="Princes%20Park%20%28Dartford%29">Princes Park</a> on 24 November 2021 in the delayed 2019–20 final, postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
